snippet: Evidence suggests that the brash billionaire builder’s dominance in presidential primary polling is no mere “summer fling.”
abstract: Polls show Donald J Trump has built demographically and ideologically diverse base on strength of celebrity and personality, rather than substance of his views; Trump's particular appeal, surprising given divided nature of Republican party, protects him from negative consequences of his shocking statements; obstacles remain, however, to his securing Republican presidential nomination.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO, NATE COHN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: Evidence suggests that the brash billionaire builder’s dominance in presidential primary polling is no mere “summer fling.”

headline.main: Why Donald Trump Won’t Fold: Polls and People Speak
headline.print_headline: Why Trump Won’t Fold: Polls and Rapt Supporters Speak
